intro: Biarum carduchorum var. platyspathum, commonly known as the broad-leaf Dutchman's pipe, is a member of the Aristolochiaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, broad leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. The plant produces unique, pipe-shaped flowers that are often greenish or reddish in color. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including the Philippines and Indonesia. This species is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments.
